Neuroscience.structures.Frequency_Detector¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Frequency_Detector.Frequency_Detector(res, list_neurons=[], controller=None, delta_t=690, spike_detector=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to detect and calculate the firing frequency of neurons in a neural network.

The Frequency_Detector class monitors the activity of a set of neurons and computes their firing frequency. It provides methods to update firing rates, calculate frequencies, and convert these frequencies into different formats.

name¶

The name of the frequency detector, initialized as “Frequency_Detector”.

Type

str

watch_neurons¶

The list of neurons being monitored for their firing frequency.

Type

list of Abstract_Neuron

len¶

The number of neurons being monitored.

Type

int

resolution¶

The resolution of the simulation, affecting time steps.

Type

int

timestamps¶

A 2D array to track the last two spike times for each neuron.

Type

numpy.ndarray

frequency¶

An array to store the calculated firing frequency for each neuron.

Type

numpy.ndarray

max_sum_frequency¶

The maximum possible sum of frequencies based on the number of neurons being monitored.

Type

float

delta_t¶

The time threshold after which a neuron’s frequency is reset if no spike is detected.

Type

int

controller¶

A reference to the controller managing the neurons, if applicable.

Type

object

time¶

A variable to track the time in the simulation.

Type

int

timer_active¶

A flag to indicate whether the timer is active or not.

Type

bool

spike_detector¶

A flag to indicate whether the spike detector mode is active.

Type

bool

clock¶

A list to track the timing for each neuron, relevant when the spike detector is active.

Type

list of int

calculate_frequency(index)[source]¶

Calculates the firing frequency for a specific neuron.

Parameters

index (int) – The index of the neuron in the watch list.

convert_to_motion(motor)[source]¶

Converts the frequency ratio to a motion value for a specified motor.

Parameters

motor (int) – The motor for which the motion value is to be calculated.

Returns

The calculated motion value.

Return type

float

frequency_ratio(lower_bound=- 2, upper_bound=2)[source]¶

Calculates the normalized frequency ratio based on the sum of neuron frequencies.

Parameters

  • lower_bound (float, optional) – The lower bound for normalization, defaults to -2.

  • upper_bound (float, optional) – The upper bound for normalization, defaults to 2.

Returns

The normalized frequency ratio.

Return type

float

get_freq(index)[source]¶

Gets the frequency of a specific neuron, scaled by 1000.

Parameters

index (int) – The index of the neuron in the watch list.

Returns

The firing frequency of the neuron.

Return type

float

is_firing(index)[source]¶

Checks if a specific neuron is firing.

Parameters

index (int) – The index of the neuron in the watch list.

Returns

True if the neuron is firing, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

max_frequency = 9.00900900900901¶

The maximum possible frequency for a neuron, in spike/thousand steps of simulation.

neurons_fire_string()[source]¶

Generates a string representation of the firing status of all monitored neurons.

Returns

A string where each character represents the firing status of a neuron (‘1’ for firing, ‘0’ for not firing).

Return type

str

new_init_(controller, new_to_watch)[source]¶

Re-initializes the Frequency_Detector with a new set of neurons to monitor.

Parameters

  • controller (object) – A controller managing the neurons.

  • new_to_watch (list of int) – The new list of indices of neurons to watch.

print_frequency()[source]¶

Prints the frequency of each monitored neuron.

sum_frequencies()[source]¶

Sums the frequencies of all monitored neurons, scaled by 1000.

Returns

The total sum of frequencies.

Return type

float

update_firing_rate(k)[source]¶

Updates the firing rate of the monitored neurons based on their activity.

Parameters

k (int) – The current time step in the simulation.
